data.title: burgers for dinner, pancakes for breakfast
data.text: open til midnight on weekends, this place is a throwback to the good old days, Sinatra playing in the background, jumbo pitchers of coffee. full stacks of pancakes, 3 types of non-maple syrup. cops on their lunch break. I usually order the burger and fries to go for late night cravings.

data.title: One of my favorites for breakfast
data.text: Love going here. Not the healthiest of cuisines but awesome if that's the food you like to eat. Love the hash browns. My favorite is the crepes Swedish. Easy to swap and change menu..  Staff always friendly and efficient. Wait for food is quick even when busy. Going to have to wait in line on Saturday and Sunday mornings.  Sometimes 15-30 minutes but it's worth the wait.

data.title: Fresh Hot Food
data.text: Found the IHOP while looking for a BBQ place.  Decided that crepes were what my sweet tooth needed.  The service was attentive and the food came out fresh and hot!.  They Banana and Nutella crepes for desert also nice and fresh and hit the spot.  Definately would recommend this location

data.title: Simple breakfast
data.text: This was my first time at an IHOP. The plain pancakes were delicious and the eggs were done perfectly. Great service.

data.title: typical hop..
data.text: decent food, decent service, but many places better in town for around same price...bonus that it's in walking distance for us

data.title: A Declining Landmark and Icon . . . .
data.text: Something has gone awry with this restaurant after it became an owner-franchise.  I guess, the staff who run the place also own it.  Prices have gone over the top and even applying the daily promos/specials, one feels nothing came or felt discounted and worth returning.  Being bi-lingual (English/Spanish) would be helpful here in terms of getting what you actually ordered or expected.

data.title: Portioned Capitalism at its finest
data.text: Today I ate breakfast here and I had coffee and the breakfast sampler plate. While the food was What was expected from IHOP the price was certainly not. My bill was $18 for one person. Unbelievable! I will not be going back. The food was ridiculously portioned for the price. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere because I feel the owner thinks he can charge outrageously because the location which is ridiculous.

data.title: IHOP - The Legend Lives On
data.text: What can I say? They own it when it comes to pancakes and waffles. Its like a fine tuned engine. Well tested and tweaked with sweet decadence. I love it. But lets get some tables for non booth peeps.

data.title: Clean
data.text:
I had never been to an IHOP so I thought we would try it.

It was clean and the staff was friendly.

I was shocked by the prices ($10 for a plain Belgian waffle).

They had a large menu of fancy pancakes, waffles, crepes, etc. but I'm an old fashioned girl and will stick to Denny's with their cheaper prices.

data.title: Good coffee and sandwiches
data.text: We stopped for lunch on our way back from Point Reyes.  IHOP is always a good choice when you don't know the area.  We were seated quickly, our food came right out, and it tasted good.  Our server was friendly and efficient.  About what you would expect from a well-run IHOP.

data.title: Let's get breakfast at IHOP!
data.text: Local residents go the IHOP for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.  I particularly love to have breakfast there with a friend; we can read the paper, chat and feel at home. Then the eggs and sausage and pancakes arrive! Coffee at the IHOP is always, always good and the restuarant is conveniently located.  If I were visiting San Rafael with plans to go to the beach or San Francisco that particular morning, the IHOP fits into that day so well.  The service is cheerful and efficient, the manager has been there for many years and treats everyone with a knowing congeniality.My friends and I appreciate the reasonable prices as well as the way the place operates. There are no pretensions here.  Breakfast at Tiffany's? No,we look forward to a comfortable satisfying breakfast at IHOP;
